sub_title: Inspector, Chemical weapons munitions specialists of OPCW
summary:
Preparation of inspections, by reviewing and analysing relevant technical information of the inspection sites including declarations provided by the States Parties
Performing inspections in sites located in the member states worldwide
Contributing to technical briefings, prior to deployment to the inspection site and mission debriefings upon completion of the inspection. 

I have 26 years of work experience in Ammunition Management and Demilitarization chemical weapon, Ordnance Management, Mine Action, Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) Control, Counter-IED, Explosion and Ballistic Protection (EBP), Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD), Blast/Ballistic Analysis, Manufacture of Arms and Ammunition, Procurement, Quality Control of General Stores and Clothing and logistics. I am trained and qualified as ATO and Improvised Disposal (IEDD) Operator at the Ordnance Centre and School, Bangladesh Army and Ordnance Engineering College, PLA, China. I have worked as chief logistics of Sector North of MINUSMA, Mali at United Nations.
